intro: Malleastrum sambiranense, commonly known as the Sambiranense malleastrum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It grows in moist, shaded habitats, typically in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
